sentences.en: Can you speculate how such damage might arise?
sentences.cn: 你能否想出这种伤害是怎样引起的?

sentences.en: Critics of the project speculate about how many hospitals could be built instead.
sentences.cn: 对该项目持批评态度的人在推测如果改作他用不知可以建多少所医院。

sentences.en: He can only speculate as to which horse will win the race.
sentences.cn: 他只能推测那一匹在赛马中会获胜.

sentences.en: I allowed myself to speculate on the subject, and drew up some short notes.
sentences.cn: 我专心思考这个问题, 作出了一些简短的札记.

sentences.en: It is interesting to speculate on some of the reasons for this kind of bad thinking.
sentences.cn: 推测一下形成这类不良思维方式的一些原因是很有趣的.

sentences.en: It is premature to speculate about the resumption of negotiations.
sentences.cn: 现在猜测谈判是否会重新开始还为时过早。

sentences.en: It would be unfair to Debby's family to speculate on the reasons for her suicide.
sentences.cn: 猜测黛比自杀的原因对她的家人来说是不公平的。
做投机买卖是很危险的.

sentences.en: Its occupation was to speculate on Laetitia Dale's modest enthusiasm for rural pleasures.
sentences.cn: 她还强迫自己接受利蒂霞·戴尔对农村的恰如其分的依恋感情.

sentences.en: Jones refused to speculate about what might happen.
sentences.cn: 琼斯拒绝猜测可能会发生什么事情。

sentences.en: On the way home, they'd speculate and wonder about the treasure.
sentences.cn: 在回家的路上, 他们就对那宗财宝猜测一番.

sentences.en: The banks made too many risky loans which now can't be repaid, and they speculated in property whose value has now dropped.
sentences.cn: 银行贷出了太多现在无法偿还的风险贷款，而且他们在房地产业做了投机买卖，其价值目前也已经下跌。

sentences.en: The doctors speculate that he died of a cerebral haemorrhage caused by a blow on the head.
sentences.cn: 医生推测他死于头部受击引起的脑溢血。

sentences.en: This is an occasion that makes a man speculate on all he has lost.
sentences.cn: 现在倒是我估计一下自己所失去的一切的时候了.

sentences.en: We shall be enabled to speculate with security on the former extension of the land.
sentences.cn: 我们就能够稳妥地推测从前的陆地范围了.

sentences.en: We should speculate about the purpose of life.
sentences.cn: 我们应该想想人生的目的.

sentences.en: Well, at present we won't speculate on hypotheticals.
sentences.cn: 嗯，目前我们不想去推测那些假想的东西。

words.tran_cn: 投机的；推测的；思索性的
投机；推测；思索；投机买卖

trans.tran_en: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details
to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details
